title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 152.6 - New York State personal income tax returns of military personnel
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 152.6 - New York State personal income tax returns of military personnel

State Regulations
A member of the Armed Forces of the United States is
required to file his New York State personal income tax return at the same time
and in the same manner as any other taxpayer. However, see section
696
of the Tax Law with respect to the time
for filing a New York State personal income tax return by a member of the Armed

Forces of the United States serving in an area properly designated as a combat
zone, or who is hospitalized as a result of such service. Also, see Part 157 of
this Article for provisions relating to extensions of time to file New York

State personal income tax returns. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
152.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
